ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.2_0: At this time Venerable Udāyī knew that the Buddha had prohibited sitting alone with a woman on a private and concealed seat suitable for action, and so instead he sat alone in private with the same girl. When they were able, they just chatted; otherwise he gave her a teaching.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.3_0: A second time Visākhā had been invited to that family.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.4_0: When she arrived, she saw him sitting alone with that girl,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.6_0: “Venerable, it’s not appropriate for you to sit alone with a woman on a private seat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.7_0: Although you may not be aiming at that act, people with little confidence are hard to convince.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.9_0: After leaving, Visākhā told the monks what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.10_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.11_0: “How can Venerable Udāyī sit alone with a woman on a private seat?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.12_0: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.13_0: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you sat alone with a woman on a private seat?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.16_0: “... Foolish man, how can you sit alone with a woman on a private seat?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.17_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.18_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.19.1_0: ‘Although a seat is not concealed, nor suitable for action, it may be suitable for speaking indecently to a woman.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.20_0: If a monk sits alone with a woman in private on such a seat, and a trustworthy female lay follower sees him
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.21_0: and accuses him of an offense entailing suspension or an offense entailing confession,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.22_0: then, if he admits to the sitting, he is to be dealt with according to one of these two
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.23_0: or according to what that trustworthy female lay follower has said:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.1_0: Or a seat is not concealed on a concealed seat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.2_0: not concealed by a wall, a door, a screen, a cloth screen, a tree, a pillar, a grain container, or anything else.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.4_0: one is not able to have sexual intercourse.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.5_0: It may be suitable for speaking indecently to a woman:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.6_0: one is able to speak indecently to a woman.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.10_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.14_0: a human female, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal; one who understands and is capable of discerning bad speech and good speech, what is indecent and what is decent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.18_0: just the monk and the woman.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.20_0: there is private to the eye and there is private to the ear.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.22_0: one is not able to catch up or dirt while wound, or shouting his head, or threw his head into a bag.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.24_0: one is unable to hear ordinary speech.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.26_0: the monk sits down or lies down next to the seated woman.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.27_0: The woman sits down or lies down next to the seated monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.28_0: Both are seated or both are lying down.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.30_0: she has attained the fruit, she has understood the Teaching.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.32_0: have gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.33_0: Having seen (that), he does not see (him).
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.1_0: She accuses him of an offense entailing suspension or an offense entailing confession,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.2_0: then, if he admits to the sitting, he is to be dealt with according to one of these two
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.3_0: or according to what that trustworthy female lay follower has said:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.4_0: If she accuses him like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.5_0: “I’ve seen you seated with a woman while sitting,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.6_0: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.7_0: If she accuses him like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.8_0: “I’ve seen you seated with a woman while sitting,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.10_0: “It’s true that I was seated, but I didn’t make physical contact,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.11_0: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.13_0: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.15_0: then he is not to be dealt with.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.16_0: If she accuses him like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.17_0: “I’ve seen you lying down, making physical contact with a woman,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.18_0: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.19_0: “It’s true that I was lying down, but I didn’t make physical contact,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.20_0: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.22_0: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.24_0: then he is not to be dealt with.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.25_0: If she accuses him like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.26_0: “I’ve heard you speaking indecently to a woman while seated,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.27_0: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.28_0: If she accuses him like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.29_0: “I’ve heard you speaking indecently to a woman while seated,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.31_0: “It’s true that I was seated, but I didn’t speak indecently,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.32_0: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.34_0: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.36_0: then he is not to be dealt with.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.37_0: If she accuses him like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.38_0: “I’ve heard you speaking indecently to a woman while lying down,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.39_0: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.40_0: “It’s true that I was lying down, but I didn’t speak indecently,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.41_0: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.43_0: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.45_0: then he is not to be dealt with.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.46_0: If she accuses him like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.47_0: “I’ve seen you seated alone with a woman on a private seat.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.48_0: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.50_0: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.52_0: then he is not to be dealt with.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.53_0: If she accuses him like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.54_0: “I’ve seen you lying down alone with a woman in private,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.55_0: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.57_0: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.59_0: then he is not to be dealt with.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.61_0: this is said with reference to the preceding offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.63_0: not determined. It is either an offense entailing suspension or an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.1_0: If he admits to going, and he admits to sitting, and he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.2_0: If he admits to going, and he admits to sitting, but he does not admit to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.3_0: If he admits to going, and he admits to sitting, but he does not admit to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the sitting.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.4_0: If he admits to going, but he does not admit to sitting, nor does he admit to an offense, he is not to be dealt with.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.5_0: If he does not admit to going, but he admits to sitting, and he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.6_0: If he does not admit to going, but he admits to sitting, yet he does not admit to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.7_0: If he does not admit to going, but he admits to sitting, yet he does not admit to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the sitting.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.8_0: If he does not admit to going, but he admits to sitting, nor does he admit to an offense, he is not to be dealt with.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.9_0: The second undetermined offense is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.10_0: “Venerables, the two undetermined rules have been recited.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.11_0: In regard to this I ask you,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.23_0: The undetermined offenses have been well laid down
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.24_0: By the Stable One, the Buddha who is the best.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.25_0: The chapter on undetermined offenses is finished.
